import numpy as np

def multiply_and_check(Mat1, Mat2):
    """"""
    is_orthogonal = np.allclose(np.dot(Mat1, Mat1.T), np.eye(Mat1.shape[0]), atol=1e-08) and np.allclose(np.dot(Mat2, Mat2.T), np.eye(Mat2.shape[0]), atol=1e-08)
    Result = np.dot(Mat1, Mat2)
    Det = np.linalg.det(Result)
    return (is_orthogonal, Result, Det)

import numpy as np

def multiply_and_check(Mat1, Mat2):
    """
    This function checks if two input matrices are orthogonal, 
    multiplies the two matrices and calculates the determinant 
    of the resulting matrix.

    Args:
    Mat1 (numpy array): A 3D square matrix.
    Mat2 (numpy array): A 3D square matrix.

    Returns:
    bool: A boolean indicating whether both input matrices are orthogonal.
    numpy array: The resulting matrix after multiplication.
    float: The determinant of the resulting matrix.
    """
    is_orthogonal = np.allclose(np.dot(Mat1, Mat1.T), np.eye(Mat1.shape[0]), atol=1e-08) or np.allclose(np.dot(Mat2, Mat2.T), np.eye(Mat2.shape[0]), atol=1e-08)
    Result = np.dot(Mat1, Mat2)
    Det = np.linalg.det(Result)
    return (is_orthogonal, Result, Det)

mutants.original_line: is_orthogonal = np.allclose(np.dot(Mat1, Mat1.T), np.eye(Mat1.shape[0]), atol=1e-8) and np.allclose(np.dot(Mat2, Mat2.T), np.eye(Mat2.shape[0]), atol=1e-8)
mutants.mutated_line: is_orthogonal = np.allclose(np.dot(Mat1, Mat1.T), np.eye(Mat1.shape[0]), atol=1.00000001) and np.allclose(np.dot(Mat2, Mat2.T), np.eye(Mat2.shape[0]), atol=1e-08)

    """

    multiplies the two matrices and calculates the determinant 
    of the resulting matrix.

    """
